reviews.text: The Nikko Hotel is conveniently situated in a quiet area of the city quite close to the Petronas Towers. Ampang Park underground station is adjacent making travel around the city extremely easy and fast. The hotel lives up in every way to its five star classification and the well trained staff are totally committed to making the residents' stay a memorable one. The Serena Brasserie food is superb, the choice enormous.
reviews.title: Conveniently Situated Excellent Five Star Hotel

reviews.text: Tripadvisor.com is my standard tool for selecting hotel for each of my leisure and business trips but when it comes to selecting a hotel in Kuala Lumpur, it is always InterContinental Kuala Lumpur. Excellent location close to KLCC, one of the finest breakfast buffet spreads including Asian delicacies, most spacious and updated rooms and a huge bath area. A particular mention about the toiletries Ginseng & Macademia by "WE LIVE LIKE THIS" of UK. So sensuous and soothing that a shower with the shower gel or a rub of hand & body lotion would keep you fresh for the whole day. A particular request to the management not to change the brand.
reviews.title: The Most VFM InterContinental in Far East

the room is big, the bed was huge! 240 x 200cm. the bath room? i just loved it.. nikko hotel never disappoint me no matter which cities their in.. the room was clean, neat, classic luxury, the location was just great! only 15min walk to the Suria KLCC (Petronas Tower). the hotel concierge was friendly and helpful. i didnt get to try the breakfast but im sure it was good... the hotel lobby is big. would i come back? reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This time around, I was to arrive by last Malaysia Airlines flight from Bangkok which was cancelled due to technical snag. The airline put us up at Novotel Bangkok Airport Hotel. First thing I did at 0025hours midnight upon checking into my room was call up Intercontinental KL and tell them to retain my booking despite no-show which was beyond my control. The tele[phone operator who took my message (named NITA) confirmed over phone immediately that my booking will be retained as I had given my credit card details for guarantee.
reviews.title: Amaizing

reviews.text: Despite all these efforts, when I arrived at the hotel the next day, I was informed that my booking was bumped off due to no show and that hotel was totally full so there was no way I could be accommodated. The front office lady, Ms. Anne frantically started calling nearby hotels to check if a room was available but all top hotels refused. I was then informed that Grand Millenniuum at Bukit Bintang has a room and confirms availability if I could give them my credit card# for guarantee. This put me off even more and I yelled as to why she asks me to give credit card details for Millenniuum hotel if they could not guarantee my booking in their own hotel! I insisted on talking to Duty Manager before giving my credit card details for Millenniuum.
reviews.title: Convenient location, unsatisfactory booking/checking in experience

reviews.text: Suddenly then, the undertone changed. The front office staff got into the room behind, perhaps in a huddle and finally came back stating that one Premier Room has just been cancelled which is being allotted to me but I need to give them time to prepare the room. They also provided me an access to Club Room but I could never make use of it due to my hectic meetings schedule.
reviews.title: Great staff

reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Nikko KL again for 3 nights from 24 Aug. My previous stay at this hotel was in July 2009. This time I booked through asiatravel.com which offered a Pay 2, Stay 3 nights deal and it turned out to be a highly lucrative deal. I have been familiar with the hotel being a repeat guest and I noticed that the quality/decor of rooms has been well maintained.
reviews.title: My favourite when on Business

reviews.text: I noticed one additional service that I am not sure was available earlier and that is an hourly shuttle to KLCC which otherwise is a short walk away. Instead they should have one for Bukit Bintang (BB) but that is just a suggestion. For me it does not matter as I have a local associate who is more than willing to accompany me to BB so don't need a shuttle.
reviews.title: We will all definitely be back again & again

reviews.text: One pleasant surprise I noticed in the buffet breakfast spread is an inclusion of vegetarian chinese dishes on the Asian food counter. This is a boon for vegetarians who have to otherwise depend only on breads, fruits and cereals besides a couple of standard options such as hash browns and baked beans. The mock meat based vegetarian chinese is a delight for vegetarians with a craving for local Asian taste. Moreover, this time I also noticed a live noodle counter which also was another option for vegetarians.
reviews.title: Just excellent

reviews.text: Two of us stayed here while passing through KL on holiday. The price seemed extremely reasonable for being a top hotel in KL. On arrival, we saw that the Lobby area looked amazing. Very big, spacious, stair cases and bustling with staff and guests. The staff were friendly and immediately took our luggage and let us check in. The room was very nice, modern, clean. The desk was spacious, with plug sockets, paper. Everything you need if you are travelling here on business. The TV is big, loads of channels and the beds are very comfortable. Our room had a window which looked into the bathroom which was very odd, but a blind is available for privacy should you want to put it down. Breakfast was certainly one of the best parts of the stay. So definitely have breakfast. A large dining area, nice surroundings, and amazing food choices from all cuisines. Such as Chinese, Malaysian, English, Spanish, Indian.. The location is great. Only a short walk to the subway station and close to the Petronas Towers and down town KL as well. If I was to come back to KL, I would he more than happy to stay here again.
reviews.title: Breakfast that will change your life

description: A jewel in the heart of Malaysia, InterContinental Kuala Lumpur offers one of the most sought after locations in the city, making it an ideal urban retreat for both business and leisure travelers. The hotel is just steps away from the iconic Petronas Twin Towers and Kuala Lumpur Convention Centre and within walking distance to countless other shopping and entertainment activities. Choose to work in comfort or luxury in the 473 spaciously designed rooms, including 110 newly renovated Grand Premier Rooms that feature modern, earth tone furnishings and state-of-the-art enhancements. Wine and dine in style with a selection of restaurants including the award-wining Tatsu Japanese Restaurant, Tao Chinese Cuisine, Serena Brasserie, OneSixFive and Bentley's Pub. InterContinental Kuala Lumpur also boasts eight meeting rooms and two conference venues to host memorable events from an intimate group of 20 or a large conference of 600 people. In our effort to constantly upgrade the hotel services & facilities for our valued guests; please be informed that the hotel has embarked on an improvement project to renovate our function space from 15 December 2013 - 17 January 2014.
